scenarios.name: Simple Headache
scenarios.description: Young adult with simple headache, clear communication

exchanges.ai: Hello! I'm your medical intake assistant. What brings you in today?
exchanges.patient: Hi, I've been having headaches for the past three days.

exchanges.ai: I'm sorry to hear that. On a scale of 1 to 10, how would you rate the pain?
exchanges.patient: I'd say about a 6 out of 10. It's pretty uncomfortable but I can still work.

exchanges.ai: Where exactly is the headache located?
exchanges.patient: Mostly in the front of my head, and it gets worse in the afternoon.

exchanges.ai: Are you experiencing any other symptoms along with the headache?
exchanges.patient: No, just the headache. Nothing else.

exchanges.ai: Are you currently taking any medications for this or anything else?
exchanges.patient: Just ibuprofen, but it doesn't seem to be helping much. I take 400 milligrams twice a day.

exchanges.ai: Do you have any allergies to medications?
exchanges.patient: No, no allergies.

exchanges.ai: Have you had headaches like this before?
exchanges.patient: Not really. I get occasional headaches but nothing that lasted this long.

scenarios.name: Complex Multi-Symptom
scenarios.description: Multiple symptoms, medications, and family history

exchanges.ai: Hello! What can I help you with today?
exchanges.patient: I've been feeling really tired lately and I've been having some chest discomfort.

exchanges.ai: How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
exchanges.patient: The fatigue has been going on for about two months, but the chest discomfort just started last week.

exchanges.ai: Can you describe the chest discomfort? Is it pain, pressure, or something else?
exchanges.patient: It's more like pressure or tightness. It comes and goes, usually after I eat.

exchanges.ai: On a scale of 1 to 10, how severe is the discomfort?
exchanges.patient: Maybe a 4 or 5. It's uncomfortable but not unbearable.

exchanges.ai: Are you currently taking any medications?
exchanges.patient: Yes, I take metformin 500 milligrams twice a day for diabetes, and lisinopril 10 milligrams once a day for blood pressure.

exchanges.ai: Do you have any allergies to medications?
exchanges.patient: I'm allergic to penicillin. I get hives when I take it.

exchanges.ai: Is that a serious reaction?
exchanges.patient: It's moderate. Just hives, no breathing problems.

exchanges.ai: Do you have any other medical conditions besides diabetes and high blood pressure?
exchanges.patient: I also have high cholesterol. I'm on atorvastatin 20 milligrams once daily.

exchanges.ai: Is there any family history of heart disease?
exchanges.patient: Yes, my father had a heart attack at 55, and my brother has heart disease too.

exchanges.ai: Do you smoke or drink alcohol?
exchanges.patient: I quit smoking 5 years ago, but I used to smoke a pack a day for 20 years. I have a glass of wine occasionally, maybe once or twice a week.

scenarios.name: Unsure Medication Names
scenarios.description: Patient unsure about medication names, requires clarification

exchanges.ai: What brings you in today?
exchanges.patient: I've been having some back pain for about a week now.

exchanges.ai: On a scale of 1 to 10, how bad is the pain?
exchanges.patient: About a 7. It's pretty bad.

exchanges.ai: Are you currently taking any medications?
exchanges.patient: Yes, I take something for my blood pressure. I think it starts with an L? And there's another one for my diabetes.

exchanges.ai: Could the blood pressure medication be lisinopril?
exchanges.patient: Yes! That's it. Lisinopril.

exchanges.ai: And for the diabetes medication, is it metformin?
exchanges.patient: I'm not sure. It's a white pill. I take it in the morning and evening.

exchanges.ai: That could be metformin. Do you know the dosage?
exchanges.patient: I think it says 500 on the bottle.

exchanges.ai: Okay, so metformin 500 milligrams twice a day. Are you taking anything else?
exchanges.patient: Just some ibuprofen for the back pain, but it's not helping much.

exchanges.ai: Do you have any medication allergies?
exchanges.patient: No allergies.

scenarios.name: Unclear Symptoms
scenarios.description: Patient gives vague descriptions, requires probing questions

exchanges.ai: What brings you in today?
exchanges.patient: I just don't feel right. Something's off.

exchanges.ai: Can you describe what you mean by not feeling right?
exchanges.patient: I don't know, just tired I guess. And maybe dizzy sometimes?

exchanges.ai: How long have you been feeling this way?
exchanges.patient: Um, maybe a few weeks? I'm not really sure when it started.

exchanges.ai: Let's focus on the dizziness. When does it happen?
exchanges.patient: Sometimes when I stand up. Not all the time though.

exchanges.ai: Does it go away quickly or does it last a while?
exchanges.patient: It goes away pretty fast. Just a few seconds.

exchanges.ai: And the tiredness - is it worse at certain times of day?
exchanges.patient: Yeah, I guess it's worse in the afternoon. I just want to nap all the time.

exchanges.ai: Are you taking any medications currently?
exchanges.patient: Just my vitamins. Nothing prescription.

exchanges.ai: Do you have any medical conditions we should know about?
exchanges.patient: No, I've always been pretty healthy.

exchanges.ai: Any allergies to medications?
exchanges.patient: Nope, no allergies.

expected_output.timing: dizziness when standing, fatigue worse in afternoon

scenarios.name: Patient Refusal
scenarios.description: Patient uncomfortable sharing certain information, tests graceful handling

exchanges.ai: Hello, what can I help you with today?
exchanges.patient: I need to see a doctor about some stomach issues.

exchanges.ai: I understand. Can you tell me more about the stomach issues?
exchanges.patient: I'd rather not go into details right now. I'll discuss it with the doctor.

exchanges.ai: That's completely fine. I just need some basic information. How long have you been experiencing these issues?
exchanges.patient: About a month.

exchanges.ai: Are you currently taking any medications?
exchanges.patient: I don't feel comfortable sharing that information with a computer. No offense.

exchanges.ai: I completely understand. Your privacy is important. Let me just ask - do you have any allergies to medications? This is critical for your safety.
exchanges.patient: Okay, that makes sense. Yes, I'm allergic to sulfa drugs. I get a severe rash.

exchanges.ai: Thank you for sharing that. That's very important information. Is there anything else you'd like to add before seeing the doctor?
exchanges.patient: No, I think I'll wait to talk to them in person.

exchanges.ai: Absolutely. I've noted your allergy to sulfa drugs. The doctor will go over everything else with you shortly.
exchanges.patient: Thank you.
